alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 9:58PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cherry and northeastern Sheridan Counties through 1000 PM MDT... At 858 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles southwest of Merriman to near Gordon to Rushville. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Rushville, Clinton, Intersection of Highway 87 and Craven Creek Road, Highway 61 crossing the Snake River, Morgan Lake, Lone Butte, Irwin, Intersection of Highway 87 and Larabee Road, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Mount Maria, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road, Highway 250 crossing the Niobrara River, Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Rock Hill, Bayonne, Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road, Hoover Lake, Intersection of Highway 61 and Shadbolt Road and Billys Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 86 and 127. Highway 250 near mile marker 34, and between mile markers 37 and 48. Highway 61 between mile markers 198 and 209. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for the Panhandle of and north central Nebraska.
